title: Peatlands Way Walking Route

images.title: Steve  F, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sykehouse lock on the New Junction Canal. The path on the left forms a section of the Trans Pennine Trail it crosses the canal here to continue North on the opposite bank. The canal is an extremely straight section of The Sheffield and South Yorkshire Navigation.

images.title: Ian Paterson / Hatfield Moors
images.caption: Hatfield Moors. Typical scenery in this area, part of the Humberhead Peatlands National Nature Reserve. Mixture of trees, man-made lakes, grasses and peat. Lots of spongy peat underfoot makes it a delight to walk upon.

images.title: Glyn Drury / Peat Bog on Thorne Moor
images.caption: Peat Bog on Thorne Moor

images.title: Steve  F, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Thorne Moors viewing platform. The only viewing platform in the Humberhead Peatlands National Nature Reserve.

images.title: Information boards on Peatlands Way, W end of Thorne Waste by Colin Park, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Information boards on Peatlands Way, W end of Thorne Waste

images.title: Peatlands Way towards Crowle by Ian S, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Peatlands Way towards Crowle

images.title: One of the ponds east of Peatlands Way by Neil Theasby, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: One of the ponds east of the trail

images.title: Peatlands Way at Moorends by Ian S, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Moorends

description: This waymarked circular walk takes you through the moorland and lowland raised bogs around the town of Thorne near Doncaster. The walk visits Crowle, Belton, Epworth, Haxey, Kirk Bramwith and Sykehouse. You will also cross the famous Thorne Moors and Hatfield Moors, wildlife sites of national and European importance. The walk includes some easy waterside sections along the River Don and the New Junction Canal.
